pages.text: Bernese Mountain Dogs only have one gene that has been witnessed to affect how they look, and this is the B Locus. This gene will determine whether they have rust-colored points or tan points.

The B Locus has two potential alleles, the dominant 'B' and the recessive 'b'. The 'B' allele creates redder, rust points, while the 'b' allele creates less saturated, tan points. Dogs with one copy of 'b' will carry the tan trait and may pass it on to pups, providing the potential for tan pups depending on the other parent. Dogs with two copies of 'b' will always create either tan carriers or tan puppies.
